meanings.sent1: The puffed cheeks of the squirrel showed it had stored many nuts.
meanings.sent2: The puffed balloon floated gently in the air.
meanings.sent3: The puffed-up frog tried to impress the others with its size.
meanings.sent4: The puffed clouds in the sky looked like giant cotton balls.
meanings.sent5: The puffed-up jacket made the child look like a little marshmallow.

meanings.definition: To breathe heavily or blow air forcefully
meanings.sent1: After running, she puffed heavily to catch her breath.
meanings.sent2: The old steam engine puffed smoke as it chugged along.
meanings.sent3: The exhausted puppy puffed around the yard after playing fetch.
meanings.sent4: The train puffed its way up the steep mountain, huffing and puffing.
meanings.sent5: The tired hiker puffed up the hill, taking breaks to catch his breath.

meanings.definition: To praise or promote something in an exaggerated way
meanings.sent1: The company puffed its new product as the best on the market.
meanings.sent2: The author puffed his latest book in interviews, claiming it was a masterpiece.
meanings.sent3: The chef puffed his own cooking skills, saying he was the best in town.
meanings.sent4: The politician puffed his achievements, hoping to win more votes.
meanings.sent5: The salesman puffed the benefits of the vacuum cleaner, promising it would change your life.
